required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 09, 2023
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Treatment Patterns Among Patients With Venous Thromboembolism in the United States
clinical_study.official_title: Post-Discharge Treatment Patterns and Outcomes in Patients With Venous Thromboembolism

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to assess outpatient treatment patterns following hospitalization for venous thromboembolism (VTE). VTE is a condition that occurs when blood clot forms in the vein.
This is a retrospective study (assessments on events that have already occurred) of healthcare claims from databases. The study sponsors will assess healthcare claim records of patients treated with either apixaban or warfarin. Assessment includes treatment persistence, switch, and stopping therapy, along with recurrent VTE and bleeding.

primary_outcome.description: Proportion of patients treated with apixaban or warfarin during hospitalization for venous thromboembolism.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed from hospital discharge date to up to 30 days following discharge date
primary_outcome.description: Proportion of patients who continue on apixaban or warfarin following discharge from the hospital.

primary_outcome.time_frame: assessed from outpatient treatment start date up to the earliest of treatment discontinuation or switch, or end of study period. Assessed up to 4 years
primary_outcome.description: Among patients who continue apixaban or warfarin post-discharge, assess treatment duration; including persistence, switch and discontinuation.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: assessed from outpatient treatment start date up to the earliest of treatment discontinuation or switch, or end of study period. Assessed up to 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: Patients with at least one hospitalization for recurrent VTE.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: assessed from outpatient treatment start date up to the earliest of treatment discontinuation or switch, or end of study period. Assessed up to 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: Patients with at least one hospitalization for major bleeding.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: assessed from outpatient treatment start date up to the earliest of treatment discontinuation or switch, or end of study period. Assessed up to 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of patients with at least one inpatient or outpatient encounter for clinically relevant non-major bleeding.

study_pop.textblock: Patients who are hospitalized for venous thromboembolism (VTE) and treated with apixaban or warfarin during the hospitalization. Patients will be identified through linkage of IQVIA's hospital charge data master database (CDM) with outpatient professional fee medical claims (Dx) and longitudinal prescription claims (LRx) databases during the period of July 2018 and August 2022.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- inpatient hospitalization with primary discharge diagnosis of venous thromboembolism (VTE) (this is the index hospitalization)
- treatment with apixaban or warfarin during the hospitalization
- at least 18 years of age
Exclusion Criteria:
- Hospitalization for VTE within 6 months prior to the index hospitalization
- Diagnosis of atrial fibrillation/flutter or procedure for mechanical heart valve in the 6 months prior to the index hospitalization
- Procedure for inferior vena cava filter or diagnosis of pregnancy during the study period
- Prior use of oral anticoagulants or parenteral anticoagulants

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

patient_data.ipd_description: Pfizer will provide access to individual de-identified participant data and related study documents (e.g. protocol, Statistical Analysis Plan (SAP), Clinical Study Report (CSR)) upon request from qualified researchers, and subject to certain criteria, conditions, and exceptions. Further details on Pfizer's data sharing criteria and process for requesting access can be found at: https://www.pfizer.com/science/clinical_trials/trial_data_and_results/data_requests.
